review.description: Thankful for this 24 hour shop in Brooklyn to fuel my late-night Ben and Jerry needs.
review.author: Sarah S.

review.description:
My friend I visited lives right next to this convenience store. 

I've tried their sandwiches twice. They're good. Not super fantastic. But still respectable food. This last time I ordered their lamb schwarma. They ask if you want it with white and red sauce and what kind of bread. I said sure to the sauces and I wanted it on a pita! Turns out the sauces are like a mayo/yogurt/tzatziki type sauce and hot sauce. Pretty good, pretty good. Though I did get this at 3am. Score for being open 24 hours! I finished the other half of this two days later and it was still edible.
review.author: Kim P.

review.description:
Last night I came to Gold Street Market and something I wasn't expecting happened. I ordered two panini sandwiches to go (Chicken Fajita and Tuna Melt). They both came on pita instead of bread! At first I was a little worried because I was really expecting two slices of panini-pressed white, wheat or Italian/French bread.  However, once I started eating them, I was impressed! They were both delicious. Perhaps it shouldn't have surprised me as much as it did, but I thought it was worthwhile to update my review so that others know about the pita in case it's not your thing. 

As an aside, the Chicken Fajita was much better than the Tuna Melt. I tend to like my tuna melts on the cheesier side, and this one just wasn't very cheesy. After having been here well over a dozen times, I can tell you that my favorite sandwich is the FDNY - breaded chicken cutlet, cheese, lettuce and tomato. I think it's noted on the page now, but they are officially open 24 hours a day!
review.author: Calvin D.

review.description: Great selection of food for decent prices and the employees are super friendly. I usually order burgers and fries and they never disappoint.
review.author: Kaori S.

review.description:
Very convenient, reasonable prices, good selection of groceries, large menu of sandwiches and wraps and super friendly staff. Falafel and chicken cutlet wraps are delicious. Unfortunately, the produce section leave much to be desired. 

Overall, an ok grocery store but a great bodega/deli.
review.author: Collin B.

review.description:
I live right next to this place, and it is the best bodega place I have come across in NYC. The staff is extremely friendly, and there is no minimum for credit/debit cards. I have had 2 subs and a breakfast sandwich. All were well priced, nicely portioned, and tasty! They also have a great selection of household goods/groceries for anything you might have forgotten at the supermarket. 

Love this place!
review.author: Michelle B.

review.description: LOVE this place!  Open 24 hours. Staff is so nice, awesome variety, great prices!
review.author: Sasha D.

review.description: Always wonderful service. I go here at least once a week to grab breakfast or lunch, never had a bad experience.
review.author: R P.

review.description: I had a great experience here.  Very reasonable prices for the area and it's kind of tucked away so you don't feel pressured to decide what you want.  The hot food is great and the service with a smile is awesome.   I will definitely be back.
review.author: Johnny F.

review.description: I wish I could rate this higher but I have just had too many bad experiences. Check the expiration dates a lot of their food is expired. I bought cold cut cheese and it was very dry and crusty on the edges.
review.author: Amanda N.

review.description: I have been anxiously awaiting the grand opening of this deli since I moved into the area, and now that its here, I can say that I have not been let down! It is conveniently located between the two Brooklyn Gold buildings. It's great for grabbing something on the go, or as Calvin D said, for when you're cooking dinner and realized that you've missed an ingredient. While it is on the small side, it is stocked with a large variety of items. Prices are extremely reasonable, especially on the fruit. Check out their bakery section. They have hugeeeee danishes/donuts for only 1.50. Insane! The employees here are also very friendly. Plenty of check-ins to come!
review.author: Marla B.

review.description: Like all other deli/corner stores in NYC, Gold Street can be seen as "overpriced".  However, the entire staff here is consistently friendly, no matter what day of the week. I sometimes go here to grab a quick lunch. The deli's Chicken Ceasar Wrap is their best keep secret (I like to add olives).  And, yes, they deliver.
review.author: Scott G.

review.description:
Best convenience store ever! Great selection (boyfriend and I like to joke that they have four cans/cartons/boxes of every food on earth), and the nicest employees. They are always great to chat with, even at 2am! They often ask what we'd like to see on their shelves, and it's fun to see our suggestions appear a few weeks later. 

One wish: Please bring back the s'mores ice cream! We bought it once, it was AMAZING, and then we never saw it again.
review.author: H P.

review.description: I really like this place. Aside from the free delivery, 10% student discount and the no credit card minimum, the staff is really nice and the food is great. It's a very friendly atmosphere and they always have just what I need....No complaints here.
review.author: Alicia D.

review.description: This place is a god send for the neighborhood. Not only are they really well stocked with reasonable prices but they are also very nice! I have never had a bad experience here. Apparently they also deliver (haven't needed it as I live in the building - maybe if I get the flu?!). AND they are open 24 Hours now! What more could you need?!
review.author: Austin H.

review.description: After 10 days visiting NYC, I think this bodega is the highlight. The breakfast and dinner menu is restaurant quality and the prices are extremely reasonable. And the staff... so friendly! I smile just thinking about how nice and courteous they are to their customers. If you're just visiting NYC, skip Lombardi's and stop by Gold Street Market.
review.author: Rafael E.
